reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Access to Justice Process Report for Bety Carino and Jyri Jaakkola murder cases

description.narrative: Bety Carino and Jyri Jaakkola, members of a human rights defenders? caravan headed towards an indigenous people?s community in San Juan Copala, were murdered by a paramilitary group in an ambush in 2010. Since the ambush, the lawyers of the Grupo de Accion por los Derechos Humanos y la Justicia Social has demanded the arrest, judgement and sentencing of the perpetrators in order for impunity to be avoided. The European Parliament?s Subcommittee on Human Rights has also requested Mexico for information on th e progress in the case, and the victims? families have been active, but progress has been slow. Written and audiovisual documentation of the case is hoped to help in submitting it to the Inter-American court of Human Rights. In addition, the project aims f or the witness protection programme coverage to be expanded to all kinds of legal cases in Mexico. During the project the media, written and video material related to the legal case will be compiled and a comprehensive audiovisual document will be produced , the state and federal criminal investigations will be compiled and organised chronologically, the legal information on the criminal process against the five presumed authors will be systematized, the political accompaniment of the case in Europe and in M exico will be systematized, an in-depth analysis of the entire process and the victims? relatives? participation in it will be produced. The report will be translated into English and Finnish and it will be disseminated in Mexico and internationally. The p roject beneficiaries include the victims? relatives as well as Mexican human rights defenders. https://www.facebook.com/GrupoDeAccionDDHH/
